problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure items fit within the box dimensions
        assert x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure positions are non-negative
        assert x_y_positions[i].x >= 0
        assert x_y_positions[i].y >= 0
        # Ensure box_id is within valid range
        assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id <= 20
        
fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# Equality constraints for redundant fields between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[j].box_id:
                # Non-overlapping constraint: either i is to the left, right, above, or below j
                assert (
                    x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or
                    x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x or
                    x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y or
                    x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y
                )

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# Equality constraints for redundant fields between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_and_positioning(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits in box dimensions
        assert x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure coordinates are non-negative
        assert x_y_positions[i].x >= 0
        assert x_y_positions[i].y >= 0
        # Ensure box assignment is valid
        assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id <= 20
        # Ensure no overlap with other items in the same box
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if item_box_assignments[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[j].box_id:
                assert (
                    x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or
                    x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x or
                    x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y or
                    x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y
                )
    # Synchronize redundant fields between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
        assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
        assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

ensure_item_assignment_and_positioning(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300)
})

# Object type for box assignment and positioning of an item
ItemPlacement = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=300)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 300
BOX_WIDTH : int = 300
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 14, "height": 69}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 23, "height": 86}, {"width": 84, "height": 42}, {"width": 12, "height": 72}, {"width": 97, "height": 96}, {"width": 60, "height": 71}, {"width": 57, "height": 86}, {"width": 77, "height": 62}, {"width": 41, "height": 56}, {"width": 7, "height": 56}, {"width": 62, "height": 84}, {"width": 29, "height": 97}, {"width": 63, "height": 82}, {"width": 53, "height": 62}, {"width": 22, "height": 93}, {"width": 25, "height": 64}, {"width": 50, "height": 96}, {"width": 21, "height": 45}, {"width": 92, "height": 1}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if item_box_assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = item_box_assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_used: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_index: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_index > max_box_used:
            max_box_used = box_index
    return max_box_used

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

):

        assert pos.y >= 0

    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxPosition)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.

        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.

    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

def ensure_no_overlap_between_items(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxPosition),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Non-overlapping condition: either:
                # 1. i is to the right of j: xi >= xj + wj
                # 2. j is to the right of i: xj >= xi + wi
                # 3. i is above j: yi >= yj + hj
                # 4. j is above i: yj >= yi + hi
                assert (positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width) or \
                       (positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width) or \
                       (positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height) or \
                       (positions[j].y >= positions[i].y + items[i].height)

    # This constraint ensures that the assignment values are within valid range
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

        assert assignments[i] <= 20

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxPosition)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: one item must be completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or
                    x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x or
                    x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y or
                    x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    # Ensure that each item is assigned to a box (already covered by field constraints)
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = x_y_positions[i].x

        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0
        assert pos_x + item_width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos_y + item_height <= BOX_HEIGHT

items_fit_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxPosition)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                # Rectangles do not overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x) or \
                       (x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x) or \
                       (x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y) or \
                       (x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y)

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
):
    # Ensure that nr_used_boxes correctly reflects the maximum box index used
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        if item_box_assignments[i] > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = item_box_assignments[i]
    assert nr_used_boxes == max_box_index

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---
BoxPosition = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0)
})

Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=300)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 300
BOX_WIDTH : int = 300
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 14, "height": 69}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 23, "height": 86}, {"width": 84, "height": 42}, {"width": 12, "height": 72}, {"width": 97, "height": 96}, {"width": 60, "height": 71}, {"width": 57, "height": 86}, {"width": 77, "height": 62}, {"width": 41, "height": 56}, {"width": 7, "height": 56}, {"width": 62, "height": 84}, {"width": 29, "height": 97}, {"width": 63, "height": 82}, {"width": 53, "height": 62}, {"width": 22, "height": 93}, {"width": 25, "height": 64}, {"width": 50, "height": 96}, {"width": 21, "height": 45}, {"width": 92, "height": 1}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxPosition)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    # The objective is to minimize the number of boxes used
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        if item_box_assignments[i] > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = item_box_assignments[i]
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
minimize(objective)
